especially since the last artist i

carson
got a zero and i was not really big on

here honestly uh just like ken carson
i'm just not really seeing what's so

more like in my ken carson review i
think the winner in this whole situation
the person who i can truly praise
uh is playboy cardi cause that man
smartly forged a style forged a sound

than he himself could feed alone and
ultimately it's to everyone's benefit
i'm sure financially this label deal is

his label get pushed directly to his
fans who are only seeking out more music
that sounds like his yeah i mean
ultimately it makes sense it's great
it's uh it's good
everybody
wins
everybody win win win but like um if if
only the music
were we're good cause i'm running into a

uh ken carson on this destroy lonely
record ultimately vocally i could not
pick this man out of a lineup
slathers his voice in a lot of auto-tune
too which again ultimately is not
necessarily a bad thing but it's pretty

making his very boring uh vocal timbre
sound more interesting when in fact it
really doesn't now look i think a
generic or a so-so voice could be uh
maybe a non-factor if you deliver with a

but destroy lonely doesn't even bring
that to the table i find it funny that
stuff like this continues to be labeled
as like rage music or gets put in this
box uh where it's kind of compared to
playboy cardi stuff because obviously
it's on the opium label the playboy
cardy fans are consuming it but i don't
see what is so hype or exciting or
um i don't know visceral or aggressive
about this i mean maybe in some respects
it goes hard live but on the record
itself the energy is very middle of the
road and so so there's not a whole lot
of sparks or fireworks to be had frankly
cardi approaches the mic with a lot more
energy with a lot more charisma uh guys
like check west as well or travis scott
take the intro track off this record for
example which sounds almost as
passionless and as monotone as a nav
song much of the appeal of this music
comes down to the vibe but
the vibes are rancid like i could
complement this record if it managed to
work even as background music but
it's way too annoying to serve even as
that the second track has one of the
worst flows and melodies i've ever heard
on any melo trap song really the best

lonely essentially rides it with the
same flow over and over and over

becomes this mind-numbing thing that
you're not really thinking about because
there's no song there there's no
interesting bars there there's nothing

really want to be paying close attention
uh the fifth track for example he says

maybe a song idea maybe a song structure

remembering
maybe some wit in the writing it's not

a tenth and eleventh as entertaining as

where uh destroy lonely starts
incorporating some

uh kinda
